statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Clemson 69, The Citadel 54
article.story: CLEMSON, S.C. -- Demontez Stitt scored 16 points and Clemson defeated The Citadel 69-54 on Sunday. Jerai Grant and Devin Booker added 13 points apiece for the Tigers (11-4). Grant also had seven blocks. Clemson won its sixth straight, despite shooting just 12 of 24 from the free-throw line, including 7 of 8 down the stretch. Zach Urbanus scored 17 points and Mike Groselle added 14 points and 10 rebounds for The Citadel (5-9), which made 6 of 7 3-pointers before missing five straight in the final 3 minutes. The Tigers led by as many as 17 points in the opening half and held a double-digit advantage the rest of the way. Stitt made back-to-back 3-pointers and Milton Jennings added a basket during an 8-2 Clemson run that gave the Tigers a 52-36 lead with 11:03 to play. The Bulldogs pulled within 11 with 3 minutes left after a pair of free throws by Urbanus. Clemson forced 18 turnovers while committing only seven. The Tigers opened the scoring with Booker's first 3-pointer and weren't threatened the rest of the way. The Tigers extended the lead to 22-7 on Booker's second 3-pointer with about nine minutes left in the first half. Booker made all three of his 3-point attempts -- all in the first half -- but was only 2 for 7 from 2-point range.
